item.title: Callouts
item.description: Callout support Quartz supports the same Admonition-callout syntax as Obsidian. This includes 12 Distinct callout types (each with several aliases) Collapsable callouts See documentation on supported types and syntax here.

item.title: Making sense of Shuffle hash join and Broadcast join in Spark
item.description: Shuffle hash join Shuffle hash join is a join strategy where repartitioning is based on join key. This is considered as a wide transformation since shuffling of data between partitions is required, hence the word “shuffle” in its name.

item.title: Spark - an overview of architecture
item.description: Overview Spark is a popular open-source framework that provides several tools for analytics and processing of data in parallel fashion. While MapReduce-based systems often involve disk-expensive operations, computation in Spark avoids this by keeping jobs in memory.
